structure.unit: Regulation Of Trade And Certain Enterprises

law.catch_line: Providing Information To Unauthorized Person; Penalty
law.text: Any officer or employee of a consumer reporting agency who knowingly and willfully provides information concerning an individual from the agencyâ€™s files to a person not authorized to receive that information shall be punished by a fine of not more than five thousand dollars or by imprisonment for not more than one year, or both.
